column5: By far the best pike thread I've seen since I joined! I can't wait to chase some of those next week
Agreed,gotta love the different patterns and colors! Great thread guys!

Took awhile to catch this one.  She broke a rod one time then stole another one down a hole.  Finally, one autumn day in 2008 there she is in the shallows off the point entering the back bay.  Cast out, big wake as she rushes the lure and BOOOOOM!!!  She smokes it.  Finally the Cheepas Monster is in the boat... well, almost in the boat.  Big fish.  Best to date.  What a GATOR!
My biggest. Up at Bluffy Lake in ear falls. Caught on 4 pound fluro, no leader.

Drifter_016 The biggest pike you caught at Eddies the one where you are wearing the red and black bibs.What was the length and est. wt.? We are heading up in the 3rd week in june.It would be nice to catch a giant like that!
It was 45" and guessing somewhere between 25 and 30 pounds.  But the best thing was I caught it on my 9wt Sage fly rod.
Mine's not the biggest compared to others but sure gave me a great fight... 32"
Huge head on that one Ryan
nice gators everyone i don't know why anyone would not like pike
Some real beasts here!
Man those last bunch were huge,Awesome fish everyone!!!!!!!!!!
My sons new PB caught over the weekend 27".  Won't be long before he beats my 34".
My biggest pike so far, 41.5 inches, was released. Can't wait to crack the 45 inch barrier
I love catching pike, they are my target fish in the summer on Simcoe, bass a close second
Some gorgeous gators guys. Keep em coming!
Basskicker, that last one is the fish of a lifetime!
Gotta love big gators!  Hoping to break 50in this year (That's a tough one to break, lol)
LOL, I just want to break 35!

My 48.5 was such a tease..  Worst part is I had a 50+ all but hooked last year but just sat there with a stupid look on my face and watched it spit out my offering.    Seeing a fish that big in 3ft of water was unreal.
Moosebunk that is impressive man. WoW !
Here's some more pike porn from the archives. I love big pike too and should be chasing them again for a week starting Saturday, IF the damn ice goes out up north!
Here's my best. Caught with 6lbs test
Wouldn't mind seeing some of TG's from Geary World
My brother with a nice one from Lac Seul. He's a big dude and that shrinks his fish a little.    Smaller one from Nipissing on walleye tackle:
One from Valens this past winter......    Burt
All you guys are posing with the same fish, I can see the resemblance
Few more solid ice pike.                              PikeSlayerinator2006.  The Original.  Worked awesome.
WOW. Some awesome pike in this thread. I am happy everyone is enjoying it. Finally a fishing thread with no arguments and good old fashioned fish pics.
gotta love the fish porn !!! the more the better,some huge pike everyone....awesome
How aboot them Senators?
A few more big girls from me.                                  I'm heading out shortly to try and add some more piggys!!
Not sure about the rest of you, but all those amazing gator pics have me pumped! I have to plan a pike day soon. Thanks for sharing!
Since Pike has such a horrible rap amongst many of the fisher folk, lets spend some time to honor those fallen snot rockets. Here is the biggest from this weekends opener...
My oldman with a cow out of Gloucestor last year.    My 48.5incher being released.
I love catching pike. They taste pretty good too.  I caught a couple more yesterday (pair of well fed little 24-25" fish). I'm hoping I can catch a 40" pike this year. Very underrated.
My biggest to date    And my biggest from this past winter.
Why anyone hates these beautiful fish is beyond me, here's my new PB from the weekend, 33"
Because they're scary, and icky!
I will always eat pike over other types of fish because they taste great and hardly anybody else eats them as opposed to walleye or trout

My personal best, 35" on my homemade spinnerbait. They give some really nice fillets once the y bones are out and are a lot of fun to catch. Such angry, aggressive fish that are hard to spook and love hitting next to the boat, what more could you ask for?

I have an affinity for big pike. Big Pike are totally different than small pike, it's like fishing for totally different species. In the lakes I fish big pike are not easy to find and catch, especially once the water hits over 65 degrees. It's especially a challenge finding them in the summer, sometimes not even worth the effort but is possible. I've had success trolling big baits 25 ft+ down and landed some nice ones, but you will never go out and land 5 in an evening. They are spread out, roaming, hard to locate. Most of my pike fishing is done after spring opener until musky opens then very late fall and winter. The challenge in catching big pike and avoiding the small pike in the southern ontario waters I fish holds a certain allure for me and what I like about the species.  Here's one of two 38"s from this weekend. Could not break the 40" goal. The water temp was prime around 54 on Saturday we ended up with 62ish when I left on Monday. Next weekend should be good fishing again.
Just a wee one from last year opener on Lac St Louis near Beauharnois Que
Got this one on a figure-8. Not nearly as big as many of the ones you guys have caught but I'll get there some day.
That's a great photo Rich, one of your best!  I'm most proud of the larger Pike I've bumped into in my neck of the woods.  Not really known for big Pike anymore.
my biggest pike so far.
?! Who are these heathens? Pike are awesome.
Had baked Cajun pike last night, was awesome.
Some people need a better measuring tape... Lol  All nice fish tho.  Who disrespects pike? Musky guys, maybe. Cuz they can't handle the challenge of trophy pike
Short and Fat.  Not the longest I have caught, but the most chunky for sure.  Pic doesn't do it any justice.
My biggest from the Ottawa river 48"

I don't mind catching pike at all but I usually never fish for them they are almost always caught while I am trolling for walleyes !!!! Like the one in my pic and it's fun as I'm only using walleye rods and reels thankfully I use 20lb braid most of the time but I do have some some big ones snap me off as they bite through floro leader pretty easily !!! Some nice pike pictures everyone is showing as well !!!!!!! Cheers
Biggest Two Ice Pike.    Biggest Nipigon Pike.    Biggest Kesagami Pike.    Biggest Attawapiskat Pike.    Biggest Pike From Home on the Moose River.
dear lord those are some massive gators
